.definition: to be an abbreviation or symbol of something
.example: GMT stands for Greenwich Mean Time.

.definition: to be in a better situation, if or after something happens
.example: She would have been better off if she had stuck with teaching

.definition: in one direction and then in the opposite direction, esp. repeatedly
.example: He was up and down the hall worrying about it.

.definition: general health and happiness
.example: It was good for their overall well-being.

.definition: most of
to gradually accept a sad situation
.example: I couldn't come to terms with it.

.definition: don't worry about something; forget it; it doesn't matter
.example: Doesn't that describe what we do with fish?Never mind.

.definition: it is not surprising
.example: No wonder the children are excited - this is the first time they've been abroad.

.definition: to take place, especially without being planned
.example: Can you tell us more about how the project came about?

.definition: to continue doing something
.example: If you keep on practicing, you'll eventually master this skill.

.definition: to plan how something should look and arrange it in this way
.example: The countries did not lay out plans for a peace agreement.

.definition: to depend on, to rely on
.example: They looked to the government for additional support.

.definition: to think of and write (something short, such as a list)
.example: He could barely make out her signature.

.definition: to reach a decision, to decide
.example: I couldn't make up my mind whether to attend Harvard or Stanford.

.definition: used to make a suggestion
.example: How about sushi for dinner?

.definition: having feelings of affection for someone or something, or having a liking for an activity
.example: Charles is fond of driving, so I’m happy just to be a passenger.

.definition: by a great amount
.example: Some people think Tom Hanks is by far the best actor in America today.

.definition: an amount of something that can be held in one hand:
.example: He scooped up a handful of soil and examined it carefully

.definition: a small amount of (something)
.example: There was a touch of sadness in her voice.

.definition: to be at fault or culpable
.example: I think the government’s to blame, really.

.definition: the beginning
.example: I told him at the outset I wasn't interested.

.definition: because or as a result of
.example: She won by virtue of her superior intellect.

.definition: reject something offered or proposed
.example: I won’t turn down such a great offer.

.definition: have a harmonious or friendly relationship
.example: My parent don’t really get on very well.

.definition: having started and in progress; being done or carried out
.example: Economic recovery is already under way.

.definition: in order to preserve, develop, or achieve something
.example: It is vital that we reform the system in the interest of fairness to everyone.

.definition: available for sale
.example: We put our house on the market last spring.

.definition: If something has a degree of a particular quality, it has a small but significant amount of that quality.
.example: There is a degree of irony in the story.

.definition: used to say that you have something or achieve something on your own, without depending on other people
.example: You need to be successful in your own right.

.definition: Used to introduce a summary of a particular situation, especially one that is unavoidable under the circumstances.
.example: Now it’s just a case of getting them to subscribe.

.definition: to a greater extent or degree
.example: Boston is walkable, and San Francisco more so.

.definition: to approach (someone or something)
.example: Men always come up to me first.

.definition: which if true
.example: They might not let you buy the tickets yet, in which case you should try again tomorrow.

.definition: used to say that someone or something is not in a place or cannot be found
.example: I waited for two hours but there was still no sign of her.

.definition: at the same time as, when
.example: I saw him just as he left.

.definition: in order to help, improve, or please someone or something
.example: He moved to the seaside for the sake of his health.

.definition: to be able to do something because you have the ability, money, or power to do it
.example: When I know all the facts, I’ll be in a position to advise you.

.definition: in the future
.example: We’ll see how things go in the weeks to come.

.definition: given financial, material, or moral support by
.example: The group is backed by the drug trade.

.definition: used to emphasize that something is not very good, pleasant, honest etc even if you consider it in the best possible way
.example: The campaign was at best only partially successful.

.definition: A  very large or vast amount of something
.example: The library holds a wealth of knowledge.

.definition: used at the end of a list of similar things or details for showing that it is not complete.
.example: He was always late, always complaining – that sort of thing.

.definition: with the hope, aim, or intention of.
.example: These measures have been taken with a view to increasing the company's profits.

.definition: to return the way you have come; to make somebody/something do this
.example: Bad weather forced them to turn back.

.definition: to manage to do something bad without being punished or criticized for it
.example: Somehow they managed to get away with it.

.definition: remaining; not yet done or dealt with
.example: There are just three weeks to go before the end of the term.

.definition: immediately and without delay
.example: They’ll get to it straight away.

.definition: because of
.example: The concert has been cancelled owing to lack of interest.

.definition: to delay someone or something
.example: Such accidents often hold up traffic for hours

.definition: the whole of an amount or number of things, people etc
.example: We’ll do everything – cooking, washing, ironing – the lot.

.definition: at the place where you work
.example: If he’s not at home, he must still be at work.
